description: Company-wise LeetCode problems with curated source attribution ‚Äî expanded from v3 with ~25 problems/company

researchNotes.methodology: Top problems by frequency from krishnadey30 GitHub CSVs, cross-referenced with 5 curated lists
researchNotes.dataQuality: Frequencies normalized from CSV data. Sources mapped by LeetCode ID.

curatedLists.Blind 75: 75 most asked LeetCode problems (original Blind list)
curatedLists.NeetCode 150: NeetCode.io curated 150 problems covering all patterns
curatedLists.Striver SDE: Striver's SDE Sheet ‚Äî 180+ problems for Indian tech interviews

researchNotes.domainSource: Industry classification based on primary business model
researchNotes.regionSource: Company HQ / primary engineering hub location

tiers.name: S-Tier (Quant/HFT)
tiers.description: Highest paying, hardest interviews ‚Äî math, probability, DP heavy

tiers.name: FAANG+
tiers.description: Big Tech ‚Äî standard hard algorithmic interviews

tiers.name: Strong Tech
tiers.description: Established companies with solid engineering culture

companies.name: Amazon
companies.interviewTips: Focus on classic problems, bug-free coding, and explaining trade-offs. Strong LP (Leadership Principles) focus.

problems.title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock

companies.name: Meta (Facebook)
companies.interviewTips: Bug-free coding is crucial. 45 min coding rounds ‚Äî speed matters! Practice valid palindrome and parentheses variants.

problems.title: Minimum Remove to Make Valid Parentheses

companies.name: Google
companies.interviewTips: Google loves novel problems. Focus on understanding patterns rather than memorizing solutions. Explain thought process clearly.

problems.title: Longest Substring with At Most Two Distinct Characters
Longest Substring with At Most K Distinct Characters

companies.name: Microsoft
companies.interviewTips: Standard DSA focus. Strong emphasis on linked list and tree problems. Clear communication valued.

problems.title: Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Tree

companies.name: Apple
companies.interviewTips: Clean code and good design sense. Focus on readability and edge cases.
